sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均可表示"海，海洋"之意。
means: sea ： 普通用词，可用复数形式表单数意义。sea所指的面积要比ocean小得多。sea也可是ocean的一部分。
ocean ： 指把海作为一个整体，是海洋的总称，不可数名词，指大洋时是可数名词。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sǣ, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zee and German See

entry.def: The sea is the salty water that covers about three-quarters of the earth's surface.

example.ex: Most of the kids have never seen the sea...
All transport operations, whether by sea, rail or road, are closely monitored at all times.
example.tran: 所有的交通活动，无论是通过海路、铁路还是公路，都时刻受到密切监视。

entry.def: You use seas when you are describing the sea at a particular time or in a particular area.

example.ex: He drowned after 30 minutes in the rough seas...
example.tran: 他在汹涌的海浪中挣扎了 30 分钟后淹死了。

example.ex: The seas are warm further south.
example.tran: 海水的温度越往南越高。

entry.def: A sea is a large area of salty water that is part of an ocean or is surrounded by land.

example.tran: 图尔卡纳浩瀚的内陆海

entry.def: A sea of people or things is a very large number of them together.

example.ex: Down below them was the sea of upturned faces...
example.tran: 他们下面是无数张仰望的脸。

example.ex: His eyes ran over the sea of bottles and glasses on the table.
example.tran: 他扫了一眼满桌的瓶子和玻璃杯。

entry.def: You can say that someone is all at sea when they are in a state of confusion or uncertainty.

example.ex: If you had never seen a telly ad, you would be all at sea with popular culture.
example.tran: 如果你从没看过电视广告，你就搞不懂什么是大众文化。

entry.def: At sea means on or under the sea, far away from land.

example.ex: The boats remain at sea for an average of ten days at a time...
example.tran: 这些船只每次在海上平均航行 10 天。

example.ex: His body was found at sea in waters off the Canary Islands.
example.tran: 他的尸体在离加那利群岛不远的海上被发现。

entry.def: If you go or look out to sea, you go or look across the sea.

example.ex: ...fishermen who go to sea for two weeks at a time...
example.tran: 每次出海两周的渔夫们

means.word_mean: 1. a division of an ocean or a large body of salt water partially enclosed by land
2. anything apparently limitless in quantity or volume
3. turbulent water with swells of considerable size;
1. relating to or characteristic of or occurring on the sea or ships;

Sentence.sentence: Likewise, theimpactof this warming will be very different depending on where you are—coastal areas must worry about rising sea levels, while Siberia and northern Canada may become more habitable (宜居的) andappealingfor humans than these areas are now.
We can pollute the air with acids, the rivers with sewage(污水), the seas with oil.
It will have little impact on sea level when it breaks up.

Among global warming's most frightening threats is the prediction is that the polar ice-caps will melt, raising sea level so much that coastal cities from New York to Los Angles to Shanghai will be flooded

sentences.en: The lake communicates with the sea by means of a canal.
sentences.cn: 这个湖通过运河和大海相连。

sentences.en: The Mediterranean Sea boiled with the storm.
sentences.cn: 暴风雨中地中海波涛汹涌。

sentences.en: By the second day, the ship was well out at sea.
The streets are decked with a sea of red flags.

jushi.english: Very big waves dashed over the sea wall at the height of the storm.
jushi.chinese: 在暴风雨最猛烈的时候,巨浪吞没了海堤。

jushi.english: The two nations have been contending about the rights to deep sea fishing in their waters.
jushi.chinese: 这两个国家一直为他们水域中的深水捕鱼权问题争吵不休。

jushi.english: The sea cast up shells on the beach.
jushi.chinese: 海水把贝壳冲到沙滩上来了。
